bibl.title: Labored in Papyrus Leaves: Perspectives on an Epigram Collection Attributed to Posidippus (P. Mil. Vogl. VIII 309)
bibl.note: P. Mil. Vogl. VIII, 309. - A Poem Commemorates [POSIDIPPUS, XVII Gow-Page]. - On Reconsidering Posidippus. - Posidippus and the Monuments. - Posidippus and Sappho. - Posidippus and Pathos. - Conclusion.
bibl.seg: ACOSTA-HUGHES Benjamin, Alexandrian Posidippus. On Rereading the GP Epigrams in Light of P. Mil. Vogl. VIII 309.

Benjamin ACOSTA-HUGHES, Elizabeth KOSMETATOU and Manuel BAUMBACH (Edd.), Labored in Papyrus Leaves: Perspectives on an Epigram Collection Attributed to Posidippus (P. Mil. Vogl. VIII 309) = Hellenic Studies. 2 (Washington, D.C. - Cambridge, Mass. - London, 2004) pp. 42-56.
